Inits Open AI interface for use with gridworld environments.

Parameters

  • modules – Contains framework modules

  • world – The gridworld

  • withGUI – If true, observations and policy will be visualized

  • guiParent – The main window for visualization

  • rewardCallback – The callback function used to compute the reward

Oai_gym_interface module

class CoBeLRL.interfaces.oai_gym_interface.OAIGymInterface(modules, withGUI=True, rewardCallback=None)

Bases: gym.core.Env

This is the Open AI gym interface class. The interface wraps the control path and ensures communication between the agent and the environment. The class descends from gym.Env, and is designed to be minimalistic

__init__(modules, withGUI=True, rewardCallback=None)

Inits Open AI gym interface class, this interface wraps the control path and ensures communication between the agent and the environment.

Parameters

  • modules – the dict of all available modules in the system

  • withGUI – if True, the module provides GUI control

  • rewardCallback – this callback function is invoked in the step routine in order to get the appropriate reward w.r.t. the experimental design

Returns

None

updateObservation(observation)

This function (slot) updates the observation provided by the environment.

Parameters

observation – the observation used to perform the update

Returns

None

step(action)

The step function that propels the simulation. This function is called by the .fit function of the RL agent whenever a novel action has been computed. The action is used to decide on the next topology node to run to, and step then triggers the control path (including ‘Blender’)by making use of direct calls and signal/slot methods.

Parameters

action – the action to be executed

Return observation

observation after executing action

Return reward

Reward for the action executed

Return stopEpisode

flag to topEpisode

reset()

This function restarts the RL agent’s learning cycle by initiating a new episode.

Param

None

Return observation

observation after resetting RL agent’s

class UnityProcessor(env_agent_specs, agent_action_type, use_gray_scale=False, performance_monitor=None)

Bases: rl.core.Processor

This is a class keras processor for the unity interface

__init__(env_agent_specs, agent_action_type, use_gray_scale=False, performance_monitor=None)

Inits keras processor for the unity interface

Parameters

  • env_agent_specs – the group_spec object for the agent transmitted by ml agents env

  • agent_action_type – the agent_action_type string

  • use_gray_scale – set gray scale use to true/false

  • performance_monitor – for performance monitor

Returns

None

Parameters

Observation obtained by the environment processed

Processes an action predicted by an agent but before execution in an environment.

Parameters

action – Action given to the environment, data type: int

Processed action given to the environment

Processes the reward as obtained from the environment for use in an agent and returns it.

Parameters

__init__(env_path, scene_name=None, time_scale=2.0, nb_max_episode_steps=0, decision_interval=5, agent_action_type='discrete', use_gray_scale_images=False, modules=None, seed=42, timeout_wait=60, side_channels=None, performance_monitor=None, with_gui=True)

Inits a constructor to connects to a given environment executable or to the unity editor and acts as a gym for keras agents.

Parameters

  • env_path – full path to compiled unity executable, if None mlagents waits for the editor to connect

  • modules – the old CoBeL-RL modules, (currently redundant)

  • seed – Random seed, keep at 42 for good luck

  • timeout_wait – Time until Unity is declared dead

  • side_channels – possible channels to talk with the academy

  • time_scale – Speed of the simulation

  • nb_max_episode_steps – the number of maximum steps per episode

  • decision_interval – the number of simulation steps before entering the next rl cycle

  • agent_action_type – the native action type of the agent

  • use_gray_scale_images – make the processor convert images to greyscale domain, this is required when working with convolutional models

  • performance_monitor – the monitor used for visualizing the learning process

  • with_gui – whether or not show the performance monitor and the environment gui

Returns

None
